message:

It added that rescue and medical teams and fire engines were at the scene.

Hezbollah, the Iran-backed Lebanese militant group, has increased its smuggling of weapons to Iraq, specifically targeting the country's PMF, also known as the Popular Mobilization Forces. The militant group has been backing PMF factions such as the Badr Brigade, Saraya Al-Khorsani, and al-Mahdi, which have been accused of committing atrocities on Iraqi soil against Iran's behest.

According to multiple intelligence assessments carried out by Iraq's security forces, Hezbollah has been smuggling dismantled weapons from Lebanon and transporting them to PMF factions. These weapons include Katyusha rockets, drones, and anti-tank guided missiles (ATGMs), which were widely used against US forces in Baghdad and other Iraqi cities.

Hezbollah's increased involvement in the Iraqi conflict comes amid the group's efforts to expand its influence in the Middle East. With its deep ties with Tehran, Hezbollah continues to back Iranian proxies in expanding Iranian hegemony in the region.

The Hezbollah militant group has expanded its operations in Yemen by training Houthi fighters in guerrilla warfare, logistics, and the use of advanced weapons, including missile technology. title: A woman becomes commander of the Canadian Armed Forces for the first time
message:
A woman becomes commander of the Canadian Armed Forces for the first timeTORONTO (AP) — A woman has become the top commander of Canada's military for the first time.
Gen. Jennie Carignan officially took over command of the Canadian Armed Forces in a ceremony at the Canadian War Museum in Ottawa on Thursday.
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said that Carignan is the first woman to lead the military of any Group of 20 or Group of Seven country.
She was also the first woman to command a combat unit in the Canadian military, and her career has included deployments to Iraq, Afghanistan, Bosnia and Syria.
The Canadian government recently said that it would reach its NATO commitment by 2032, but specifics have yet to be provided.

title: Blast hits Iraq former paramilitaries depot
message:
(You can now subscribe to our(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channelBaghdad: An explosion ripped through "logistics" warehouses belonging to former pro-Iran paramilitaries south of the Iraqi capital Baghdad on Thursday, officials said.
"At 7:00 pm (1600 GMT)... an explosion occurred in logistics warehouses belonging to the 42 Brigade... in the Yusufiyah area, south of Baghdad," said the Hashed al-Shaabi -- an alliance of pro-Iranian former paramilitary groups now integrated into the regular army.The cause of the blast was not immediately known, and the Hashed said it assigned a committee to investigate.Firefighters were battling the blaze, it added in a statement.A security source confirmed the blast, adding that it "occurred in a warehouse storing equipment that belongs to Hashed al-Shaabi".A Hashed official said he did not rule out the possibility of an "air strike".In April, one person was killed and eight wounded in a blast at a military base housing Hashed groups in Babylon province, south of Baghdad.An investigation found the blast was caused by munitions stored on-site, not by an air strike.The Hashed al-Shaabi is an integral part of the Iraqi security apparatus under the authority of the prime minister.It includes some pro-Iran groups which have carried out dozens of attacks against US forces in Iraq and neighbouring Syria.The latest blast comes after two drones were launched on Tuesday against an Iraqi base used by US-led troops without causing any damage.

title: First woman becomes commander of Canadian Armed Forces
message:
TORONTO — A woman has become the top commander of Canada’s military for the first time.
Gen. Jennie Carignan officially took over command of the Canadian Armed Forces in a ceremony at the Canadian War Museum in Ottawa on Thursday.
In 2018, Trudeau appointed the first female head of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police and his Cabinet has been 50% female since he took office in 2015.
She was also the first woman to command a combat unit in the Canadian military, and her career has included deployments to Iraq, Afghanistan, Bosnia and Syria.
The Canadian government recently said that it would reach its NATO commitment by 2032, but specifics have yet to be provided.
event_breakdown:
* Gen. Jennie Carignan becomes top commander of Canada's military.
* Prime Minister of Canadian Justin Trudeau appoints the first female head of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.
* Details of Canadian government's plan to reach it's NATO commitment by 2032 has not been provided.

title: Israeli military to send out call - up notices for ultra - Orthodox
message:
Protest against an Israeli Supreme Court ruling requiring the state to begin drafting ultra-Orthodox Jewish seminary students to the military, in Bnei BrakJERUSALEM (Reuters) - The Israeli military is set to issue call-up notices to 1,000 members of the ultra-Orthodox community on Sunday as a divisive battle over drafting the religious Haredim into the army moves into a new phase.
Leaders of the rapidly growing ultra-Orthodox community say that forcing seminary students to serve alongside secular Israelis including women risks destroying their identity as religious Jews.
Following the first set of call-ups, further notices for an initial total of 3,000 ultra-Orthodox conscripts are expected to be sent out in coming weeks.
Israelis are bound by law to serve in the military from the age of 18 for 24-32 months.
Not all of the Haredim refuse to serve and the Israeli Defence Forces have created a number of units specially for the ultra-Orthodox.
event_breakdown:
Location: Bnei Brak, Israel
Reported event: The first conscription of ultra-Orthodox Jews in the Israeli government is a new development. The IDF will send call-up notices to 1,000 newly minted soldiers. Plans to send calls out to 3,000 ultra-Orthodox conscriptees have been finalized, with an initial 1,000 conscriptees sworn in Sunday through Tuesday.

title: Russia did not decrease intensity of its attacks despite armament supplies to Ukraine – Estonian intelligence
message:
Russia did not decrease intensity of its attacks despite armament supplies to Ukraine – Estonian intelligenceColonel Ants Kiviselg, Head of the Military Intelligence Centre of Estonia, has stated that Russia maintains the intensity of attacks in the combat zone in Ukraine despite suffering considerable losses and gradual supply of Western armament to Kyiv.
Source: the ERR portal, as reported by European PravdaDetails: Kiviselg stated that the delivery of new equipment, provided by the West, to the combat zone in Ukraine did not decrease the intensity of Russian attacks.
Kiviselg added that Russian forces did not lack personnel so far, and good weather helps them advance, even though these advances are insignificant.
Russian forces were not able to attack with armoured vehicle units but managed to achieve tactical progress in Donetsk Oblast," Kiviselg noted.
Jens Stoltenberg, NATO Secretary General, shares this point of view but warns that Moscow is still capable of advancing slightly in Ukraine.
event_breakdown: New equipment provided by West to Ukraine did not reduce Russian attacks' intensity, says Estonian intelligence

title: Bangladesh TV news off air , communications widely disrupted as student protests spike - World
message:
Bangladeshi student protesters stormed a prison and freed hundreds of inmates on Friday as police struggled to quell unrest, with huge rallies in the capital Dhaka despite a police ban on public gatherings.
Student protesters stormed a jail in the central Bangladeshi district of Narsingdi and freed the facility’s inmates before setting the facility on fire, a police officer told AFP on condition of anonymity.
“We’ve banned all rallies, processions and public gatherings in Dhaka today,” police chief Habibur Rahman told AFP, adding the move was necessary to ensure “public safety”.
“Our protest will continue,” Sarwar Tushar, who joined a march in the capital and sustained minor injuries when it was violently dispersed by police, told AFP.
Dhaka Metropolitan Police spokesman Faruk Hossain told AFP that officers had arrested Ruhul Kabir Rizvi Ahmed, one of the top leaders of the main opposition Bangladesh Nationalist Party.
event_breakdown:
Current events of security reported in text that can be placed on a map:
- Bangladeshi student protesters stormed a prison and freed hundreds of inmates on Friday.
- Police imposed a ban on public gatherings in the capital Dhaka, and a BNP leader was arrested.

title: Quang Ninh to mark Navy first victory against US forces
message:
Vietnam People's Navy soldiers shot US aircraft in Hon Gai, Quang Ninh, in the battle on August 5, 1964.
(File photo of VNA)Quang Ninh (VNA) – A ceremony will be held in the northern province of Quang Ninh to commemorate martyrs and people who died in the first victory of the Vietnam People’s Navy against the US forces in 1964.
The provincial leader asked relevant agencies to coordinate closely in preparing for the event, thus strengthening education and communications among the local community on the glorious tradition, the bravery of the people and army in general and the people of Quang Ninh in particular.
From August 2-5, 1964, the US mobilised dozens of jet fighters and attackers to bombard economic targets, military bases, and shelters of the Vietnam People’s Navy ships along the coast of Song Gianh in central Quang Binh province to Bai Chay of Quang Ninh.
In the first battle, the Vietnam People’s Navy coordinated with the Anti-Aircraft and other forces and local residents to shot down many aircraft and arrest the first US pilot./.

title: Advanced Drone Technology from India Sets New Standards for Defence Integration in Democratic Republic of Congo
message:
Ikran Aerospace introduced its latest offerings in advanced surveillance and combat UAV solutions, including weapon-integrated rotorcrafts.
A standout feature presented was the Raaya i2h, a patented fixed-wing UAV known for its exceptional versatility.
Capable of covering distances up to 100 km and enduring 6-hour missions with a 5-kg payload, the Raaya i2h garnered significant attention.
Aerial Communication Relay Center: The Raaya i2h showcased groundbreaking capability as an aerial communication relay center.
Additionally, Ikran Aerospace demonstrated its patented weapon-integrated rotorcraft, the SIRIN A1, which showcased features such as integrated camera controls and remote aiming and firing capabilities via GCS software.
